alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Orangeburg; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 01 at 9:12PM EDT until May 01 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Calhoun County in central South Carolina... Southeastern Lexington County in central South Carolina... Northwestern Orangeburg County in central South Carolina... Southeastern Richland County in central South Carolina... * Until 945 PM EDT. * At 911 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sandy Run to 7 miles southwest of Gaston, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Cayce, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Gaston, SC State Farmer`s Market, Congaree National Park, Hopkins, Sandy Run, Gadsden, Swansea, North, Pelion, Woodford, New Zion, Lexington County Airport At Pelion, Lexington Acres Pond, Peachtree Rock, Edmund, Cayce Riverwalk and Thor. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 114 and 133. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 5. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways or walk through high water.
